leads.lead_text: Hyaline apical leaf point long, regularly serrate throughout, decurrent along margins; cells in apical half densely covered in low papillose, mostly 55–80 µm long; stem subpinnately branched

Hyaline apical leaf point absent, short or rarely long, entire or with occasional small teeth, not decurrent along margins; cells in apical half smooth, mostly 8–8050 µm long; stems dichotomously branched
Leaves plicate, with 2 pleats on either side of costa; leaf apex always concolorous
Leaves weakly plicate, with a single pleat on one side of the costa or ± smooth; leaf apex concolourous or hyaline

Leaves 2–3.4 mm long, with a short or long concolorous or hyaline apical point; leaf margin toward apex usually unistratose, occasionally the lamina partly bistratose; perichaetial leaves strongly differentiated, shorter than vegetative leaves and with a blunt to broadly obtuse apex; capsules 2–3 mm long

Leaves 1.8–2.5 mm long, with a short hyaline apical point; leaf margin toward apex bistratose; lamina unistratose; perichaetial leaves weakly differentiated, about as long as to slightly longer than vegetative leaves, with a short hyaline point; capsules around 1 mm long
